firstPost.title: Hello World! From Droopy McCool
post: <table><tr><td>We used a combination of GitHub and Heroku to get our blogs online
First we created an account with GitHub and then Heroku
We then set up a sub domain and linked it to GitHub and Heroku

secondPost.title: Why Villiers
post: I am hoping that this course will teach me how to methodically solve problems. I hope to become confident in new programming languages and I am excited about the visit to Bletchley Park.
Also this counts as a D of E residential.

• Learning more about unknown programming languages
  • The food

thirdPost.title: Problem Solving And Being Lazy
post:
• Define problem clearly
  • Divide and conquer (Break up problem into smaller mini problems)
  • Mini problems are easy to solve
  • Keep the whole picture in mind
  • Keep track of what you have done and what you need to do

• If it’s been made before don’t make it again
  • Don’t be greedy (being too lazy now may be a problem in the future)
  • Write no more than needs writing
